title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field of the parameter, it is not being rejected as expected.
EB: (1) The system should validate the date value entered in the 'default value' field of the report parameter. If the date string is invalid, it should be rejected with an error message. (2) The date value should be stored correctly in the report design.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Open the BIRT report designer. 2. Create a new report parameter and set its type as 'DateTime'. 3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'. 4. Save the report design. 5. Close and reopen the report design. Verify that the invalid date value is still present in the 'default value' field.
